item.title:
In 1950, Claude Shannon built one of the world’s first examples of a machine capable of learning: a robotic maze-solving mouse known as Theseus - named after the ancient Greek hero who navigated through a Minotaur’s labyrinth.
Learn more in today’s paper: https://t.co/Zmznsdeh7J https://t.co/w04h8ZSPlP

item.title: What are the foundational principles of neuroscience? By which I mean: beliefs or assumptions that animate our study of the brain across topics. Things like a belief in a structure-function relationship or the neuron as the base unit.

item.title:
"The Magic 1089"
1. Write down a 3 digit number where the digits are decreasing (e.g. 421) 2. Reverse that number and subtract it from the first number 3. Take that answer and add the reverse to itself 4. 1089 will appear! https://t.co/RlqJ6xu6B6
